TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MobilePage extends System.Web.UI.Page

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for all ASP.NET mobile Web Forms pages. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage> class inherits from the ASP.NET <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class. To specify a mobile page and use ASP.NET mobile controls, an ASP.NET mobile Web Forms page must contain the following page directive.
``` <%@ Page Inherits="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage" Language="c#" %> ```
The `Inherits` attribute is required. The `Language` attribute is set to the language that is used on the page, if it is needed.
> [!NOTE] > ASP.NET mobile pages allow for multiple mobile forms on each page, whereas ASP.NET Web pages allow for only one form per page.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Gets a rooted URL to the current page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: A rooted URL to the current page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A rooted URL is absolute with regard to the server, but it is not a complete URL because it does not include the protocol prefix or server name.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the page's currently active form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a page is initially rendered, the first form in the page is automatically made active. On subsequent postbacks, another form might be made active, either by programmatically setting this property, or as a result of user navigation through a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link> control.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.ActiveForm%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form> control. If the current mobile device allows for access keys for controls, the button will display the access key that submits the form.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[MobileMobilePageSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileMobilePageSample/cs/Default.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[MobileMobilePageSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileMobilePageSample/vb/Default.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.exception: The page does not contain any forms.

Docs.summary: Gets the device-specific adapter for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The device-specific adapter for the control.

Docs.summary: Called after a control is added to the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.AddedControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine whether the control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form> or a <xref:System.Web.UI.UserControl> before it calls the base method. If the control is a `Form` or a `UserControl` object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.Forms%2A> property is set to `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void AddParsedSubObject(object o) cil managed

Docs.param: An that represents the parsed element.
Docs.summary: Notifies the page that an element was parsed, and adds the element to the property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Unless you override it, this method automatically adds <xref:System.Web.UI.LiteralControl> objects to the server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection> object. This collection can be accessed through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> property.
This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.AddParsedSubObject%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine whether the object is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> before it calls the base method. If the object is of type `StyleSheet`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.StyleSheet%2A> property is set to the `o` parameter.

Docs.exception: The property has already been set.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether controls on the page can have custom attributes defined. The default value is the value of the attribute of the <> section of the Web.config file. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: if the controls on the page can have custom attributes defined; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks In addition to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor> interface, the ASP.NET page framework provides a `CustomAttributes` dictionary that allows you to specify additional attributes, enable or disable custom attributing, or adjust a control's behavior or rendering. To enable or disable custom attributing, you can either set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.AllowCustomAttributes%2A> property to `true`, or you can set the `allowCustomAttributes` attribute of the <`mobileControls`> section of Web.config to `true`.
> [!NOTE] > When custom attributes are enabled, typographic errors in property names can be interpreted as custom attributes. For example, if a developer incorrectly specifies the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property of a control as "Txet", the parser would save it as a custom attribute called "Txet" instead of raising an exception. For this reason, custom attributes are disabled by default.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.AllowCustomAttributes%2A> property to enable the custom `AccessKey` attribute on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command>.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if you copy it directly into a code-behind file. You must copy this code sample into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[MobileMobilePageSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileMobilePageSample/cs/Default.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[MobileMobilePageSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileMobilePageSample/vb/Default.aspx#1)] -->

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.DeterminePostBackMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine whether the page was requested because of a transfer or a redirect. If so, `null` is returned. Otherwise, the `DeterminePostBackMode` method of the adapter is called.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is provided for convenience, and is equivalent to obtaining browser information from the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest> object, such as `Page.Request.Browser`.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool EnableEventValidation { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether postback event data should be validated. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ASP.NET controls create client-side scripts to raise postback events on the server. It is possible for a malicious user to use the postback script to send arbitrary post events to server controls. For this reason, ASP.NET version 2.0 controls validate the event data to ensure that the event was raised by client-side code rendered by the control.
Event validation is not supported in mobile pages.

Docs.param: An that represents the page state to be restored.
Docs.summary: Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the method. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is primarily used by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state. For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).
This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method and saves any existing adapter state with the view state in an object array.

Docs.returns: The absolute path corresponding to the specified virtual path.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Absolute URLs differ depending on whether the application is configured for cookieless session management. This method provides a single way to translate application URLs regardless of the cookie setting.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnViewStateExpire(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An object defined by an object that contains event data.
Docs.summary: Handles an exception caused by an expired view state on postback. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you expect to restore a page from a view state, and the page's underlying session has expired, this method's default implementation raises an exception. You can override this method, perform custom handling to restore the page state without relying on view state, and return without calling the base implementation.

Docs.exception:
The session state has expired.
-or-
The session cookie from the client is invalid.
-or-
The session state history has exceeded its allocated size.

Docs.summary: Returns the key to use to render the private view state. This field is read-only. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This field is used by adapters to render private view state. For more information, see the [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce) documentation.

Docs.summary: Gets the query string that accompanied the request. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The query string that accompanied the request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The property returns any characters in the request that follow the question mark (?) in the URL. This value can be different from the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.ServerVariables%2A> property. For devices where a unique file path suffix is inserted into a URL for postback, this property automatically strips out the file path suffix. For example, if the original query is "/home.aspx?id=john+doe", the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.QueryStringText%2A> property will be "id=john+doe". A following postback URL could be "/home.aspx?_ufps=20292303920&id=john+doe". On this last postback, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.QueryStringText%2A> property will again be "id=john+doe", because the unique suffix will be stripped out.
> [!CAUTION] > If the key portion of the key/value pair stored in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.QueryStringText%2A> property is the same as the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property of a control on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage> object, the view state and the key/value pair are removed from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.QueryStringText%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void RaisePostBackEvent (System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler sourceControl, string eventArgument);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void RaisePostBackEvent(class System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler sourceControl, string eventArgument) cil managed

Docs.param: The ASP.NET server control that caused the postback. This control must implement the interface.
The postback argument.
Docs.summary: Notifies the server control that caused the postback that it should handle an incoming postback event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.RaisePostBackEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine whether the control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form>. In that case, the method attempts to locate and call the default event handler from the active mobile Web Form. Otherwise, the base method is called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RedirectToMobilePage(string url) cil managed

Docs.param: The URL of the redirect action.
Docs.summary: Redirects to another mobile page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RedirectToMobilePage (string url, bool endResponse);
.method public hidebysig instance void RedirectToMobilePage(string url, bool endResponse) cil managed

Docs.param: The URL of the redirect action.
Specifies whether the response should be ended at that point. The default of the first form of the method is .
Docs.summary: Redirects to a specified mobile page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Gets a relative URL to the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: A relative URL to the page.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void RemovedControl(class System.Web.UI.Control control) cil managed

Docs.param: The that has been removed.
Docs.summary: Called after a control is removed from the collection of another control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RemovedControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine whether the control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form> or a <xref:System.Web.UI.UserControl> before calling the base method. If the control is a `Form` or a `UserControl`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.Forms%2A> property is set to `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Render(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The text writer that creates the markup.
Docs.summary: Sends server control content to a provided object, which writes the content to be rendered on the client. Also stores tracing information about the control if tracing is enabled. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Render%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to call the `Render` method of the control adapter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void RenderControl(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The to receive control content.
Docs.summary: Renders server control content and stores tracing information about the control if tracing is enabled. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to call the `RenderControl` method of the default control adapter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void SavePageStateToPersistenceMedium(object view) cil managed

Docs.param: An in which to store the view-state information.
Docs.summary: Saves any state information for the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.SavePageStateToPersistenceMedium%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to optimize the state data.

Docs.exception: Session state is disabled or read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance object SaveViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.SaveViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to save any existing adapter state with view state in an object array. If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the current style sheet on a object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The current style sheet for the page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A mobile page can have only one style sheet.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string StyleSheetTheme { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the style sheet applied to this page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.StyleSheetTheme%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to prevent themes from being changed from the default. This is because themes are not supported on ASP.NET Mobile Web Forms pages.

Docs.exception: An attempt was made to set this property. Themes are not supported on Mobile Web Forms pages.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Theme { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the page theme. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The name of the page theme. The property is a server-side field and cannot be modified.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.Theme%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to prevent themes from being enabled. This is because themes are not supported on ASP.NET mobile Web Forms pages.

Docs.exception: An attempt was made to set this property. Themes are not supported on Mobile Web Forms pages.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the title for the page. This feature is not supported for mobile pages. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.exception: An attempt was made to set the property.

Docs.summary: Gets a unique key that can be added to generate a unique URL for the current page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: A unique key that can be added to generate a unique URL for the current page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Some mobile browsers require a unique URL to work correctly.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Validate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Performs control validation, and then sets the property based on the results of the validation. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void VerifyRenderingInServerForm(class System.Web.UI.Control control) cil managed

Docs.param: The ASP.NET mobile control that is required in the control.
Docs.summary: Confirms that a control is rendered for the specified ASP.NET mobile control at run time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.VerifyRenderingInServerForm%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to throw an exception if the control is not in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form> at run time.

Docs.exception: must be contained in a control.

Docs.summary: Contains the source identifier to use to render the hidden field for a view state. This field is read-only. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This field is used by adapters to render view-state information. For more information, see the [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce) documentation.
